SENT.plain: Moyamoya disease is a rare progressive occlusive disease of the internal carotid arteries
We report a case of combined spinal-epidural anesthesia in a patient with Moyamoya disease presenting for Cesarean section
Hypotension associated with spinal anesthesia for Cesarean section is the most common and serious adverse effect despite the use of uterine displacement and volume preload
We continuously infused phenylephrine and ephedrine to prevent hypotension
The intraoperative hemodynamic state was stable
The patient had no significant postoperative complications
